name: Hilton Boston Back Bay

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night on a quick business trip to Boston. When I arrived a room was not available (got in around noon), so I went to the restaurant for lunch. No one was there but I had a very good meal---food is above average. The front desk called me on my mobile to tell me my room was ready. Was upgraded to a room that had a panoramic view of the area--very nice. Went to the restaurant for breakfast in the am and the buffet was very good. A quick walk thru the Sheraton to Copley plaza and cab service is quick. Would recommend a stay for business
reviews.title: Solid Nice Hotel
excellent hotel
reviews.text: I went to Boston for a weekend getaway. The hotel was extremely clean, the staff was helpful and the hotel is in agreat location. The hotel is only a couple of short blocks from theT and a great restaurant Turner Fisheries (located in a different hotel) on Huntington Ave.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night but i wish it was longer! As a hilton honors member i managed to get floor 22 which was a hilton honours floor - the view over the city was amazing!
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: The room itself was very spacious and had loads of goodies in the bathroom :-)
reviews.title: We were satisified.

reviews.text: Hotel has a nice indoor pool and i beleive recently rennovated gym. Also has a nice sun deck!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location

reviews.text: we stayed one night at the Hilton Boston Back Bay last week end. it is a pretty great hotel. we had a double room at the 11th floor. check in and check out where pretty fast. our room was an ok size double but very very clean and the furniture looked almost brand new. the bed was huge! loved the mini bar- lots of food, soda, liquor, wine and snacks (of course overpriced!). the bathroom was quite big- we did not have a large bath tub, but it was alright. the only thing that i am complaining about was that in the bathroom there was not tooth paste, there was one near the mini bar, but you had to pay for it. there is also a coffee machine which worked pretty good.
reviews.title: awesome!

reviews.text: the location is awesome. it is steps from copley, newbury and northeastern university and it is basically 200feet from the prudential center. very convenient.
reviews.title: Good Hotel in Good Neighborhood

reviews.text: the hotel has also a fitness center, which is open all day and an indoor swimming pool. unfortunately we did not had time to use it.
reviews.title: Some Problems at the Hilton Boston Back Bay

likes.disliked: — Inadequate Policies Towards Fires and Fire Alarms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i would definetely go again!
reviews.title: overall okay

reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel with very courteous staff. The reservations agent who originally took my reservation, the valet, the doorman, the desk clerk were all polite and efficient. The only staff problem was the concierge. There was never anyone at the concierge desk the entire weekend.
reviews.title: very satisfied

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Hilmton for two nights during a business trip. Overall the hotel was good but still below my usual experience with the Hilton. There is a general feeling of decadence in the service, in the outdated rooms and in the overall decoration. I recommend it to business travellers but would shy away from it for long stays.
reviews.title: OK but a bit disappointed
convenient, friendly, and spotless
reviews.text: Had a lovely time at the Hilton Back Bay. Nabbed a $90 room via Hotwire...well under the listed price. The room was ample and spotless, with many conveniences. Great bed & linens. Had a nice view from the private balcony. Large bathroom. Chocolates on the bed. Very helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in Back Bay, so the area is pretty commercial / financial (Prudential Center, Newbury St, etc). But the Prudential T stop was really convenient (2 blocks?), and Boston Common was within walking distance.
reviews.title: Central modern Hilton Boston Back Bay

reviews.text: The Hilton ensured that our weekend trip was oh-so-lovely.
reviews.title: Good place to stay in the back bay area

likes.liked: — Nice pool and hot tub - room very comfortable

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: Recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and l spent one week at this Hotel. From the moment we arrived at midnight without any luggage, which had been misplaced ex Australia, the staff could not of been more helpful.
reviews.title: Back Bay Charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They provided us with the necesities of life and a late night upgrade.
reviews.title: Great Weekend Break

reviews.text: Breakfast was first class, as was the room.
reviews.title: Nice stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst the views are tainted by the location, the location from a tourist point of view was awesome.
reviews.title: Great hotel.

reviews.text: Will gladly return next year.
reviews.title: Very nice business-class hotel

aka: Hilton Boston Back Bay Hotel Boston
